News.Title: Indus Towers Q3FY26 Results: Revenue Up 7.9% YoY
News.Summary: Indus Towers reports Q3FY26 revenue of ₹81,463 million, up 7.9% YoY. Net profit drops to ₹17,759 million from ₹40,032 million in Q3FY25. Company expands into African markets.

News.Title: Vodafone Idea Capex Boost Benefits Indus Towers
News.Summary: MOSL highlights positive implications for Indus Towers following Vodafone Idea's increased capital expenditure plans, suggesting potential growth opportunities for the telecom infrastructure provider.

News.Title: Indus Towers Sees Rs. 20.15 Cr NSE Block Trade
News.Summary: Indus Towers executed a significant block trade on NSE worth Rs. 20.15 crores involving approximately 485,062 shares at Rs. 415.45 per share, indicating institutional investor activity.

News.Title: Indus Towers drops 2.04% amid market decline
News.Summary: Indus Towers shares fell 2.04% to ₹410.65, ranking among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150. Company reported revenue growth from ₹13,954.30 crore in 2021 to ₹30,122.80 crore in 2025.

News.Title: Indus Towers Q3FY26 Results & Earnings Call Feb 2026
News.Summary: Indus Towers announces Q3FY26 results release on February 2, 2026, followed by earnings call on February 3, 2026. Company operates 256,074 towers with 415,717 co-locations across India.

News.Title: Indus Towers Sets Up Subsidiary in GIFT City
News.Summary: Indus Towers Limited approves incorporation of wholly owned subsidiary in GIFT City, Gujarat with initial investment of up to ₹20.00 crores to function as investment holding company for overseas operations.

News.Title: Indus Towers Incorporates Step-down Subsidiary in Uganda
News.Summary: Indus Towers Limited announces incorporation of Indus Infra Uganda Limited, a step-down subsidiary through Indus Towers Ventures FZE, with UGX 2 billion share capital for telecom infrastructure operations.

News.Title: Indus Towers Sees ₹66.66 Cr NSE Block Trade
News.Summary: Indus Towers witnessed a significant block trade on NSE worth ₹66.66 crores involving 1,547,822 shares at ₹430.65 per share, indicating substantial institutional activity.

News.Title: Indus Towers Expands to Nigeria and Zambia
News.Summary: Indus Towers Limited incorporates step-down subsidiaries in Nigeria and Zambia on January 15, 2026, to establish telecom infrastructure operations in African markets.

News.Title: Indus Towers eyes dividend revival on VIL AGR relief
News.Summary: Government's AGR relief for Vodafone Idea improves payment visibility for Indus Towers, raising prospects for dividend resumption after 12 consecutive quarters without payouts since May 2022.

News.Title: CITI Upgrades Indus Towers with ₹515 Target Price
News.Summary: CITI maintains a Buy rating on Indus Towers with a target price of ₹515, indicating positive outlook for the telecom infrastructure company's stock performance.

News.Title: Indus Towers Surges 5.5% to Rs 450 on Friday
News.Summary: Indus Towers shares jumped over 5.5% at market open on Friday, reaching Rs 450 and touching a day high of Rs 454. PHD Capital CEO Pradip Halder identified it as a stronger pick compared to Vodafone Idea.

News.Title: Indus Towers Gets ESG Rating of 70 for FY2025
News.Summary: Indus Towers receives improved ESG rating of 70 for FY2025 from NSE Sustainability, marking a 1-point increase from previous rating of 69. Rating assigned independently based on public disclosures.

News.Title: Indus Towers Sees ₹16.87 Cr NSE Block Trade
News.Summary: Indus Towers recorded a fresh NSE block trade worth ₹16.87 crores involving 392,214 shares at ₹430.00 per share, showing continued institutional interest in telecom infrastructure.

News.Title: Indus Towers Expands to UAE with Two New Units
News.Summary: Indus Towers launches two operational units in the UAE as part of its international expansion strategy, marking a significant step in the company's global growth plans.

News.Title: SC Backs Delhi Metro's Choice of Indus Towers
News.Summary: Supreme Court approves Delhi Metro's decision to appoint Indus Towers for providing wireless mobile connectivity services across the entire metro network infrastructure.

News.Title: Indus Towers Establishes UAE Subsidiary for International Expansion
News.Summary: Indus Towers has launched a new subsidiary called Indus Towers FZE based in the UAE as part of its global expansion strategy. The move represents the company's efforts to extend its telecommunications infrastructure business beyond domestic markets into international territories.

News.Title: Indus Towers Completes Interest and Principal Payment on Non-Convertible Debentures
News.Summary: Indus Towers made timely payment of Rs. 30,58,15,068 as interest and redeemed 3,750 Non-Convertible Debentures worth Rs. 3,75,00,00,000 on December 5, 2025, two days ahead of the December 7 due date. The company fulfilled its debt obligations at maturity, with net interest payment of Rs. 27,72,72,328 made after 10% TDS deduction.

News.Title: Supreme Court Questions Delhi Metro's Selection of Indus Towers Without Tender Process
News.Summary: The Supreme Court has asked Delhi Metro to explain why it chose Indus Towers for in-building solutions on the Airport Express Line without following a tender process. The case affects Indus Towers and Delhi Metro, with the next hearing scheduled for December 15, raising questions about procurement transparency.

News.Title: Indus Towers Receives Credit Rating Upgrade to AAA from ICRA
News.Summary: ICRA Limited upgraded Indus Towers' credit rating to AAA with stable outlook from the previous AA+ positive rating across multiple debt instruments worth Rs. 1,375 crore. The rating agency also withdrew ratings on Rs. 375 crore Non-Convertible Debentures following their complete redemption, while reaffirming short-term ratings.

News.Title: Indus Towers Shareholders Approve Re-appointment of Sharad Bhansali as Independent Director
News.Summary: Indus Towers Limited shareholders approved the re-appointment of Mr. Sharad Bhansali as Independent Director for a second term of 5 years through postal ballot with 95.744% votes in favor. The re-appointment is effective from November 19, 2025 to November 18, 2030, with 2,26,99,01,066 votes supporting the resolution out of total valid votes of 2,37,07,98,071.

News.Title: Indus Towers Sets Record Date for NCD Interest and Principal Payment
News.Summary: Indus Towers Limited has fixed November 21, 2025 as the record date for payment of interest and principal repayment on its Series III Non-Convertible Debentures listed on NSE. The company will make the actual payment on December 5, 2025, with a due date of December 7, 2025, affecting NCD holders of the ISIN INE121J08020 series.

News.Title: Bharti Airtel MD Says Indus Towers Is Undervalued, Capital Investment Would Benefit Company
News.Summary: Bharti Airtel's Managing Director has expressed the view that Indus Towers is undervalued and stated that capital investment would benefit the company.

News.Title: Bharti Airtel Gets Approval to Increase Stake in Indus Towers by Up to 5%
News.Summary: Bharti Airtel announced that its special committee of directors has approved acquiring up to 5% additional stake in tower infrastructure provider Indus Towers over time. The acquisition could happen in multiple tranches and will depend on market conditions, liquidity, price considerations, and legal compliance. Bharti Airtel currently holds 51.03% stake in Indus Towers as of September quarter-end. The company stated that consolidating its stake in the strategically important subsidiary is prudent while maintaining cash flow requirements for business operations and dividend payments. Separately, Indus Towers shares gained over 5% following Supreme Court clarification on Vodafone Idea's AGR dues, with analysts viewing potential relief to Vodafone Idea as positive for Indus Towers' dividend resumption prospects.

News.Title: Indus Towers Reports 9.7% Revenue Growth, Announces Africa Expansion Plans
News.Summary: Indus Towers reported quarterly revenue of INR 81.9 billion, growing 9.7% year-on-year, driven by strong tower additions of 4,301 macro towers and 4,505 co-locations. The company added 3,900 solar sites during the quarter, bringing the total to 36,000 sites. EBITDA declined 6% year-on-year to INR 46.1 billion with margins at 56.3%, impacted by prolonged monsoon conditions affecting energy costs. The company announced its foray into Africa, starting with Nigeria, Uganda, and Zambia, leveraging Bharti Airtel as an anchor customer. Management expects strong order book momentum for the next 3-4 quarters in India. The company maintained industry-leading network uptime of 99.965% despite adverse weather conditions. Energy margins remained negative at -4.8% due to increased diesel consumption from extended monsoon season.

News.Title: Indus Towers Shares Rise 3% on Strong Quarterly Results and Brokerage Upgrades
News.Summary: Indus Towers shares traded over 3% higher following strong quarterly results and optimism around Vodafone Idea's prospects. The company reported EBITDA margins expanding 180 basis points sequentially to 56.3%, aided by a ₹195.2 crore writeback of provisions for doubtful debts related to Vi. Revenue rose 1.6% quarter-on-quarter and 9.7% year-on-year, while net profit climbed 5.9% sequentially to ₹1,839.3 crore. Tower additions increased to 4,301 compared to 2,468 in the previous quarter. The Supreme Court's decision allowing the government to reconsider Vi's AGR dues has sparked optimism, as relief could improve Vi's cash flows and enable completion of its ₹50,000-₹55,000 crore capex plan, potentially boosting tenancy growth for Indus Towers. Jefferies upgraded the stock to 'Buy' with a target price of ₹425, citing expected 6% profit CAGR over FY26-28 and 7% dividend yield. CLSA maintains 'High Conviction Outperform' rating with ₹520 target price, while IIFL raised its target from ₹369 to ₹407. Brokerages see dividend reinstatement as a key trigger, with IIFL expecting potential dividend resumption or share buyback by end of FY26.

News.Title: Indus Towers Sets Ambitious FY27 Targets: ₹35,000 Cr Revenue and 30% ROCE
News.Summary: Indus Towers has announced strategic targets for FY27, aiming to achieve annual revenue of ₹35,000 crore and a return on capital employed (ROCE) of 30%. The company plans to expand its tower base to over 2.75 lakh towers. Key growth drivers include expansion into Africa, implementation of AI-enabled operational efficiencies, and capitalizing on 5G rollout demand. However, the company expects short-term EBITDA pressure during this growth phase.

News.Title: Indus Towers Reports Mixed Q2 Results with Revenue Growth but Lower Profitability
News.Summary: Indus Towers reported quarterly results showing revenue growth to 81.88 billion rupees from 74.65 billion rupees year-over-year. However, net profit declined to 18.39 billion rupees from 22.23 billion rupees in the same period last year. EBITDA decreased slightly to 68.76 billion rupees from 69.49 billion rupees, while EBITDA margin compressed significantly to 83.97% from 93.08% year-over-year.

News.Title: Indus Towers Seeks Shareholder Approval for Re-appointment of Independent Director Sharad Bhansali
News.Summary: Indus Towers Limited has issued a postal ballot notice seeking shareholder approval for the re-appointment of Mr. Sharad Bhansali as an Independent Director for a second term of five consecutive years from November 19, 2025 to November 18, 2030. The electronic voting period runs from October 18, 2025 to November 16, 2025. Mr. Bhansali, who holds DIN 08964527, was initially appointed as Independent Director on November 19, 2020 for a five-year term ending November 18, 2025. He is a law graduate from Delhi University with an M.A. in Economics from Boston University and MBA in Finance & Marketing from Delhi University. Mr. Bhansali serves as Managing Partner of APJ-SLG Law Offices and holds various committee positions including Chairman of HR, Nomination and Remuneration Committee and Stakeholders' Relationship Committee at Indus Towers. He maintained 100% attendance at board meetings during his tenure and received Rs. 32,50,000 as commission in FY 2024-25. The resolution requires approval as a Special Resolution through the postal ballot process.

News.Title: Indus Tower Schedules Quarterly Results Review for October 27
News.Summary: Indus Tower has announced that it will review its quarterly results on October 27. The company has set this date for the earnings review process.

News.Title: Indus Towers Establishes UAE Subsidiary with INR 200 Million Investment to Target African Markets
News.Summary: Indus Towers has approved the establishment of a wholly owned subsidiary in the UAE with an initial investment of up to INR 200 million. The company aims to target African markets including Nigeria, Uganda, and Zambia through this new subsidiary.

News.Title: Indus Towers Stock Jumps 5% as Promoter Bharti Airtel Increases Stake
News.Summary: Indus Towers shares surged 5% to ₹339.95 after promoter Bharti Airtel purchased 68.74 lakh shares (0.26% stake) through open market transactions between August 25 - September 1. The promoters held a 50% stake at the end of the June quarter. The stock had declined earlier this week following board approval for African market expansion in Uganda, Nigeria and Zambia, raising concerns about dividend payouts. The company has not paid dividends since May 2022 due to delayed payments from key customer Vodafone Idea. Brokerage firms remain positive with Ambit setting a ₹525 target, Citi maintaining a buy rating with ₹460 target, and CLSA trimming its target to ₹520 while maintaining a positive stance.

News.Title: Indus Towers Shares Fall 5% to 52-Week Low on Africa Expansion Concerns
News.Summary: Indus Towers shares dropped 5% to a 52-week low of Rs 312.60 on September 3, following investor concerns about the company's strategic expansion into African markets. The Board approved a global expansion initiative on September 2, 2025, targeting Nigeria, Uganda, and Zambia for revenue diversification and long-term growth. The company plans to leverage its financial position and relationship with Bharti Airtel, which has an existing footprint in these regions. However, the expansion raises concerns about regulatory hurdles, political instability, economic volatility, increased operational costs, currency fluctuations, and compliance challenges in foreign markets. The initiative aligns with the Indian government's policy encouraging domestic companies to expand globally. Indus Towers indicated this represents the first phase of a larger international strategy, with plans to evaluate other African countries where Airtel operates. The expansion remains subject to necessary legal and regulatory approvals.

News.Title: Indus Towers Sees Rs. 64.02 Crore Block Trade on NSE
News.Summary: Indus Towers executed a block trade worth Rs. 64.02 crores on the National Stock Exchange. The transaction involved approximately 2,012,804 shares at a price of Rs. 318.05 per share.

News.Title: Indus Towers Receives Board Approval for International Expansion Into Nigeria, Uganda, and Zambia
News.Summary: Indus Towers has received board approval to expand internationally into three African markets: Nigeria, Uganda, and Zambia. The company plans to utilize its partnership with Bharti Airtel in Africa for this expansion initiative.

News.Title: Indus Towers Reports Strong Q1 FY26 Results with 9.1% Revenue Growth, Suspends Dividend Distribution
News.Summary: Indus Towers delivered robust quarterly results with gross revenues growing 9.1% year-on-year to INR 80.6 billion and core rental revenue up 10.1% to INR 51.1 billion. The company added 2,468 macro towers and 5,777 co-locations during the quarter, bringing total macro towers to 251,800 and co-locations to 411,200. EBITDA declined 3.4% year-on-year to INR 43.9 billion with margins at 54.5%, impacted by weather-related disruptions causing increased diesel consumption. The Board decided to conserve cash in the short term, suspending dividend distribution until year-end review, citing evolving industry landscape, customer stability considerations, elevated capex, and inorganic growth opportunities. The company expanded its solar site count to over 32,000 sites and maintained network uptime of 99.96% despite challenging weather conditions. Management expects robust tower rollout momentum to continue based on strong order book visibility for the next 4-6 quarters.

News.Title: Indus Towers Stock Drops 4% After Company Decides to Conserve Cash Instead of Returning to Shareholders
News.Summary: Indus Towers shares fell over 4% to Rs 347.75 following the company's announcement to conserve cash in the short term rather than return it to shareholders. The passive telecom infrastructure company reported quarterly net profit declined 9.8% year-on-year to Rs 1,737 crore due to higher power, fuel, employee benefit, and maintenance costs, despite an Rs 88 crore write-back from Vodafone Idea receivables. Revenue rose 9.1% to Rs 8,058 crore with rental revenue growing 10.1%. BNP Paribas called the cash conservation decision 'perplexing' and lowered earnings estimates by 2-3% for FY26-28, noting the company's results were slightly below expectations. CEO Prachur Sah explained the decision stems from evolving industry landscape, elevated capex requirements, and potential inorganic growth opportunities. The company reported maintenance capex of Rs 1,190 crore in the first half of 2025, nearly matching full-year 2024 spending. Organic tower additions slowed from 4,300 to 2,500 quarter-over-quarter. Management clarified this is a short-term measure, not a permanent dividend policy change, with free cash flows remaining available for future distributions.

News.Title: Indus Towers Shares Fall 5% on Weak Quarterly Performance and Reduced Tower Additions
News.Summary: Indus Towers shares declined over 5% following disappointing quarterly results. The company's EBITDA dropped to ₹4,390.1 crore from ₹4,395.2 crore in the previous quarter, while EBITDA margin contracted to 54.5% from 56.9%. Tower additions significantly decreased to 2,468 units compared to 14,662 in the previous quarter. Profit after tax fell 2.4% to ₹1,736 crore due to higher depreciation costs and lower other income. Revenue increased to ₹8,057.6 crore from ₹7,727.1 crore. Tenancy dropped substantially to 6,079 from 18,616 in the previous quarter. The company announced no dividend or buyback and maintains doubtful receivables of ₹209.9 crore. The stock traded at ₹364.15, down 5.12%, and has declined 13.5% over the past month.

News.Title: Indus Towers Reports 9.1% Revenue Growth to Rs 80,576 Mn in Q1 FY26, Decides to Conserve Cash Short-Term
News.Summary: Indus Towers Limited reported revenue of Rs 80,576 million for the quarter ended June 30, 2025, representing a 9.1% year-on-year increase from Rs 73,830 million. However, EBITDA declined 3.4% to Rs 43,901 million with margin at 54.5%. Profit after tax decreased 9.8% to Rs 17,368 million. The company operates 251,773 towers with 411,212 co-locations and an average sharing factor of 1.63. The Board decided to conserve cash in the short term based on committee recommendations considering evolving industry landscape, customer stability, elevated capital expenditure, and potential inorganic growth opportunities. The decision will be reassessed by the end of the financial year. Operating free cash flow was Rs 14,436 million, down 17.8% year-on-year. Capital expenditure for the quarter was Rs 19,477 million.

News.Title: Indus Towers Reports Q1 FY26 Results with 9.1% Revenue Growth to Rs 8,058 Crores
News.Summary: Indus Towers Limited announced its audited consolidated financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. The company reported consolidated revenue of Rs 8,058 crores, up 9.1% year-on-year. Consolidated EBITDA stood at Rs 4,390 crores, down 3.4% year-on-year, with an EBITDA margin of 54.5%. Net profit after tax was Rs 1,737 crores, declining 9.8% year-on-year. The company operates 251,773 towers with 411,212 co-locations and a closing sharing factor of 1.63. Operating Free Cash Flow was Rs 1,444 crores, down 17.8% year-on-year. The quarter saw a write-back of Rs 88 crores in provision for doubtful receivables aided by collections against past overdue amounts. The company continues to face challenges with one of its largest customers who has material uncertainty related to going concern, with Indus carrying an allowance for doubtful receivables of Rs 2,099 million related to this customer.

News.Title: Indus Towers Schedules Q1 FY2026 Results Announcement for July 30, 2025
News.Summary: Indus Towers Limited will announce its quarterly results for the period ended June 30, 2025, on July 30, 2025. The company will conduct an earnings call on July 31, 2025, from 2:30 pm to 3:30 pm IST, where senior management will present the company's performance overview and respond to participant queries. The results pack will include quarterly report, media release, published results, key performance indicators, and conference call transcript, all available on the company's website. Indus Towers operates as one of India's largest passive telecom infrastructure providers with 249,305 towers and 405,435 co-locations as of March 31, 2025, serving major customers including Bharti Airtel, Vodafone Idea, and Reliance Jio.

News.Title: Indus Towers Anticipates Increased Competition from Starlink in India
News.Summary: Indus Towers, a telecommunications infrastructure company, is expecting heightened competition in the Indian market due to the anticipated launch of Starlink, a satellite internet service. The news suggests potential changes in the telecommunications landscape in India with the entry of this new player.

News.Title: Indus Towers: Shareholder Value Enhancement Plans Delayed
News.Summary: Indus Towers has delayed plans to enhance shareholder value, forming a committee to evaluate proposals. The company's improved cash flow, due to Vodafone Idea's repayments, raised expectations of dividend resumption. Analysts anticipate a potential dividend of ₹20 per share and a possible share buyback. The stock is down 6% following the news.

News.Title: Indus Towers: Share Price Drops 7% Following Q4 Results
News.Summary: Indus Towers' share price fell over 7% on May 2 after reporting a nearly 4% decline in consolidated profit after tax for the January-March quarter.

News.Title: Indus Towers Reports Q4 FY23 Financial Results
News.Summary: Indus Towers announced its Q4 financial results. The company reported a consolidated net profit of 17.8 billion rupees, down from 18.5 billion rupees year-over-year, but up from 40 billion rupees quarter-over-quarter. Revenue for Q4 increased to 77.27 billion rupees from 71.93 billion rupees in the same quarter last year.

News.Title: Indus Towers: Delays Bonus and Buyback Decision, Forms Evaluation Committee
News.Summary: Indus Towers has postponed its decision on shareholder value enhancement proposals, including potential bonus shares, buyback, or dividends. The company has formed a committee to evaluate all options before making a final recommendation to the board. This announcement came alongside the company's quarterly results, which showed a 4% drop in net profit but a 7.4% increase in revenue to ₹7,727 crore.

News.Title: Indus Towers: Q4 Net Profit Dips 4% Amid Accounting Impact and Higher Finance Costs
News.Summary: Indus Towers reported a 4% decrease in Q4 net profit to Rs 1,779 crore, despite 7.4% revenue growth to Rs 7,727 crore. The decline was attributed to accounting impacts from Bharti Airtel tower acquisition and increased finance costs. Vodafone Idea cleared overdue amounts, leading to a Rs 226 crore write-back in doubtful receivables provision. The company added 14,662 macro towers, bringing the total to 249,305.

News.Title: Indus Towers Q4 FY2023 Financial Results
News.Summary: Indus Towers reported its Q4 financial results. EBITDA increased slightly to 44.64B rupees from 44.32B year-over-year. Revenue grew to 77.27B rupees from 71.93B year-over-year. However, EBITDA margin decreased to 57.77% from 61.61% year-over-year. Consolidated net profit declined to 17.8B rupees from 18.5B year-over-year, but improved significantly from 40B in the previous quarter.

News.Title: Indus Towers: Q4 Net Profit Dips 4%, Revenue Rises 7.4% YoY
News.Summary: Indus Towers reported Q4FY25 results with net profit falling 4% to ₹1,779 crore, while revenue increased 7.4% year-over-year.

News.Title: Indus Towers: Board to Consider Dividend, Bonus Issue, and Share Buyback
News.Summary: Indus Towers' board will meet on April 30, 2025, to discuss options for enhancing shareholder returns, including potential dividend, bonus issue, and share buyback. The trading window for the company's shares will be closed until May 2, 2025. Analysts anticipate a possible dividend of ₹15 to ₹20 per share following improved cash flows due to Vodafone Idea resuming payments.
